DataElement.preferredName: PET Rescale Slope Float 16 Character Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The variable "m" in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).  Output units = m*SV + b.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information). It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).__To establish something relative to a new reference scale._The property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the horizontal; the tangent of the angle it forms with the positive X axis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: To establish something relative to a new reference scale.:The property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the horizontal; the tangent of the angle it forms with the positive X axis.

Concepts.definition: To establish something relative to a new reference scale.
The property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the horizontal; the tangent of the angle it forms with the positive X axis.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/14 - Released as part of caBIG Draft Content review; related CDE already released. jc  9/23/10 Created for use in Image SUV Calculation Module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
